result.execSummary:
The defendant Chaz Landon Holifield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chaz Landon Holifield is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chaz Landon Holifield was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, this includes victim witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge. Any cash bail posited on this case to be applied.  
DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
**Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.
Provide DNA sample if not already done so, pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant also advised he cannot possess firearms.

records.addlTxt: per order dated June 28, 2016, Appeal 2015AP2206CRNM (14CF1374), 2015AP2207CRNM (14CF1619), 2015AP2208CRNM (14CF4629), and 2015AP2209CRNM (15CF472), the no-merit report is rejected and the appeals are dismissed without prejudice. The deadline for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal us extended to August 29, 2016.

records.addlTxt: Only to "click" firearm restriction box, and add language per sentence.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Alicia B., and defendant as to sentencing.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he must provide a DNA sample, if not already done so and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant is also advised he cannot possess firearms.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 90  DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served.

- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments (this includes victim/witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders "use of a dangerous weapon" penalty enhancer DISMISSED.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty of the amended charge and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1 and Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Counts 1 and 3 DISMISSED.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Upon the request of parties, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld

Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
with all previous conditions of bail continued.   mld

Motion of the State to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  Court ordered forfeiture of the cash bail on the following cases as follows; $2,000.00 on case 2014CF4629, $1,000.00 on case 2014CF1619 and $1,500.00 on case 2014CF1374.    mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
FILE NOT IN COURT.  
Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial; 2014CF1374, 2014CF1619, 2014CF4629 and 2015CF472.  Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Parties are close to a resolution, per defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Current offer will remain open until the next date of 3-4-2015, per the State.  mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 All available discovery was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 12-8-2014 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail continue in full force, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant failed to appear for the Preliminary Hearing, (case 2014CF4629), scheduled in Branch 4 on 10-27-2014.  The Court withdraws warrant on case 2014CF4629.   The Court heard and grants defense motion to reinstate the cash bail in the amount of $2,000.00 on case 2014CF4629.  Court will discuss bail for all cases on the next date.  Case 2014CF4629 adjourned for Preliminary  Hearing in Branch 4 on 11-13-2014 at 8:30 am.  Cases 2014CF1374 and 2014CF1619 adjourned for Status Conference on 11-13-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  FILE NOT IN COURT.
Today's date the Court issued a bench warrant for defendant on case 2014CF4629, based on his non-appearance for the Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4.  Court now vacates the Jury Trial date of 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am, on cases; 2014CF1374 and 2014CF1619 and ordered cases adjourned for a Calendar Call in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 11-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 New defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2014CF1374 and 2014CF1619.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-16-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered that all conditions of bail are continued in full force.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Court heard and granted the motion of Attorney James Toran to withdraw as defense counsel.  

Due to a change in the defendant's financial situation, defendant ordered to the Public Defender's Office to determine eligibility.  Defendant returns from Public Defender's Office.  Defendant does qualify for representation.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel in Branch 4 on 6-24-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Status Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel stated that he is waiting for the final payment for his retainer fees from defendant.  Due to the unavailability of ADA Heitman, who was in trial in branch 4, case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-16-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
received and filed.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defense counsel is requesting a short adjournment, to finalize payment arrangements with the defendant.  Defense counsel has received discovery and will need an offer from the State.   State.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-11-2014 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail, including no violations of the law, no weapons and no contact with Britney M., are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Discovery received by defense counsel.  State will be forwarding an offer to defense counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-29-2014 at 8:30 am.  Per the Court: All conditions of bail continue in full force, including no contact with named parties on the complaint, no violations of the law and no possessionof guns.  mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James E Toran (as a friend of the Court).  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State just issued a new case for defendant, based on jail telephone calls.  Defendant waived the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.   Attorney Toran will not be representing defendant and only appeared as a friend of the Court.  

Court ordered the defendant to the Public Defender's Office to determine if he would be eligible for a Public Defender.    

Case recalled.  Defendant appeared in court pro se.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant did not go to the Public Defender's Office, and now wishes to retain private counsel.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing / Status of Counsel in Branch 6 on 5-1-2014 at 8:30 am.  ** Per the Court: Defendant must be present on next date with new counsel and be prepared to proceed with the Preliminary Hearing on the next date of 5-1-2014.  mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittany M. Alexis B., and Zoe B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
